synonyms: ポプテピピック TVアニメーション作品第二シリーズ

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Mixed Media
tags.description: Features a combination of different media and animation techniques. Often seen with puppetry, textiles, live action footage, stop motion, and more. This does not include works with normal usage of CGI in their production.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Crossover
tags.description: Centers around the placement of two or more otherwise discrete fictional characters, settings, or universes into the context of a single story.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Goblin
tags.description: A goblin is a monstrous creature from European folklore. They are almost always small and grotesque, mischievous or outright malicious, and greedy. Sometimes with magical abilities.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Tokusatsu
tags.description: Prominently features elements that resemble special effects in Japanese live-action shows

title.native: メイドインアビス 烈日の黄金郷

node.description:
**Doujin Circle**: Fumin Bein

[Website](http://bkub.webcrow.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bkub_comic) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=9948) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtRAWUYADbQh2nY5r2DP2wA)

He announced on May 2, 2022 that he got married with a woman from outside the anime/manga industry and that they have been living together since 2 years ago.

[Website](http://www.aokijun.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aokijun) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/aokijunmovie/)

Born 1981 in Okinawa, Japan
2000 Graduated from Okinawa prefectural High School and moved to Tokyo
2002 Enrolled in the Department of Design, Tokyo University of the Arts
2003 Started making independent animation films with a class assignment
In September of the same year, while working on his own projects, he formed TACOROOM, a video production team made up of five of his classmates. (dissolved in 2007)
2007 Graduated from Tokyo University of the Arts, Department of Design

(Source: aokijun.net)
**Tooru Kanegae** is a Japanese sound production manager.

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).

[Website](http://www.aokijun.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aokijun) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/aokijunmovie/)

Born 1981 in Okinawa, Japan
2000 Graduated from Okinawa prefectural High School and moved to Tokyo
2002 Enrolled in the Department of Design, Tokyo University of the Arts
2003 Started making independent animation films with a class assignment
In September of the same year, while working on his own projects, he formed TACOROOM, a video production team made up of five of his classmates. (dissolved in 2007)
2007 Graduated from Tokyo University of the Arts, Department of Design

(Source: aokijun.net)

__Height:__ 158 cm
__Hobbies & Skills:__ reading, strolling, tuba

[Profile](https://www.raccoon-dog.co.jp/talent/r10-iwami.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_manaka_430) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%9F%B3%E8%A6%8B%E8%88%9E%E8%8F%9C%E9%A6%99)

**Non-Anime Roles:**
- Saki Kashiwagi - O.N.G.E.K.I (VG)
- Radola - Gyakuten Othellonia (VG)
- Amber - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Bridget - Guilty Gear -STRIVE- (VG)
- MAI - Final Fantasy VII Rebirth (VG)
- Phantom Spy Vancuria - Mahou Sentai Magiranger (Super Sentai)
- Piper Wheel - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)
- Hikari - Blue Archive (VG)

__[Official Website](http://www.shouta-aoi.jp/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/noboru0811) | [Personal Twitter](https://twitter.com/shouta0811aoi) | [Professional Twitter](https://twitter.com/AOISHOUTAstaff) | [Youtube Channel](https://www.youtube.com/c/aoishoutaKING)__

Singer and voice actor since February 2011. Used to have a complex about his feminine voice, but he got over it because people liked that type of unique voice.

Ryuunosuke Matsushita in _Kimi to Boku_ was his first anime role. He also sings many insert songs in the same anime. Ai Mikaze from _UtaPri_ series is the role that made him popular. Debuted with the mini-album "Blue Bird" on June 26, 2013.

He is a voice actor (seiyuu) belonging to Amuleto since October 1, 2014 and previously was affiliated with Mausu Promotion.

[Website](http://www.ska-j.com/) | [Amuleto profile](http://amuleto.jp/talents/osuka-jun.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/oosuka_jun)

__Agency:__ Racoon Dog

[Agency Profile](https://www.raccoon-dog.co.jp/talent/r11-hasegawa.html)

__Non-anime roles:__
- Rosanna - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Archetype: Earth - Fate/Grand Order (VG)
- Bridget - Punishing Gray Ravens (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/H_I_R_O_K_I____)

Played Hisoka in the Hunter x Hunter musicals.

Non-anime voice roles:

- Lighter - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/emilyneves)

Emily Marie Neves is an American voice actress, ADR director and script writer known for her work on English adaptations of Japanese anime shows and films associated with Funimation and Sentai Filmworks/Seraphim Digital. In 2005, she was a preliminary contestant for the fourth season of American Idol at the Las Vegas auditions, where she advanced to the Hollywood round and was eliminated. She was a resident actress at the Alley Theatre in Houston. She was previously married to fellow anime voice actor [Andrew Love](https://anilist.co/staff/96848/Andrew-Love) and was roommates with [Maxey Whitehead](https://anilist.co/staff/103722/Maxey-Whitehead) in college.
